text: Walter Kondratovich (April 5, 1924 – August 13, 1987) was an American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at the University of Bridgeport in Bridgeport, Connecticut from 1949 to 1959. Kondratovich was a three-sport athlete at Warren Harding High School in Bridgeport. He was the starting quarterback at Columbia University in the mid-1940s under coach Lou Little. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1924 births Category:1987 deaths Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Bridgeport Purple Knights football coaches Category:Columbia Lions football players Category:Sportspeople from Bridgeport, Connecticut Category:Players of American football from Connecticut
title: Walter Kondratovich
